course.subject: BIEN
course.name: Introduction to Neural Engineering
course.description: This course will provide a survey of Neuroscience and Neuroengineering research areas to provide our research postgraduate students a broad appreciation of interdisciplinary research in context. The course aims to help student recognize and understand how knowledge from science and engineering interface in this interdisciplinary application. Concepts such as neural interfacing and neural prosthesis will be introduced so that students can understand the impact of the latest technologies. The course will enhance the vision of the students and encourage them to work in future inter-disciplinary research fields.

reviews.author: ontimegrad
reviews.title: Find good teammates
reviews.comment_content: Essentially some walkthroughs of neuroscience and neuroengineering. As a non-biology guy, these are fairly interesting, but I cannot memorize anything afterwards.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is attracting. The concepts are clearly explained with adequate introduction of the backgrounds so that laymen can follow.
reviews.comment_grading: It depends on your teammates. The first project is individual one, but the second one requires collaboration. The whole team should collaborate together to form a clear and up-to-date story. Otherwise, the grades would not be high. I score 98/100 for the first project (upper quantile is 96). But the cooperation of second project was not good. Prof. Wang was very unhappy with that. Although she said my part is fair enough, I got A- eventually.
reviews.comment_workload:
Individual assay: less than 6 pages, around several thousand words.
Group assay: ~1000 words + 2.5-4 min presentation, depends on the number of people in your group.
No attendence
